member.name: T:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.SpeechRecognitionAgent
member.summary: This class provides helper methods used to communicate with the Hawaii Speech-to-Text service. It has helper methods for contacting Hawaii Speech-to-Text Service to execute the speech-to-text translation. It accepts an audio stream as input, sends it to the speech service and receives a list of potential texts corresponding to the audio input.

member.name: M:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.SpeechRecognitionAgent.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SpeechRecognitionAgent class.
member.param: Specifies a host name of the speech service.
Specifies a grammar name loaded in the server.

Specifies a buffer containing the audio data to be translated to text. The audio buffer should have the following characteristics: 'SamplesPerSecond=16000', 'AudioBitsPerSample=16' and 'AudioChannel=Mono'.

member.name: M:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.SpeechRecognitionAgent.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Byte[],System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SpeechRecognitionAgent class.
member.param: Specifies a host name of the speech service.
Specifies a grammar name loaded in the server.

Specifies a buffer containing the audio data to be translated to text. The audio buffer should have the following characteristics: 'SamplesPerSecond=16000', 'AudioBitsPerSample=16' and 'AudioChannel=Mono'.

member.name: M:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.SpeechRecognitionAgent.GetPostData
member.summary: An overridden abstract method. It provides the POST (as in Http POST) data that has to be sent to the service. This method will be called by the base class when it needs data during a Http POST method call.
member.returns: The POST data as an array of bytes.

member.name: M:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.SpeechRecognitionAgent.ParseOutput(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: An overridden abstract method. This method is called after the response sent by the server is received by the client.
member.param: The response stream containing response data that is received from the server.

member.name: M:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.SpeechRecognitionAgent.OnCompleteRequest
member.summary: An overriden method. It is invoked after completing the service request. It does some processing of the Speech-to-Text service call result and it calls the client's "on complete" callback method.

member.name: M:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.SpeechRecognitionAgent.CreateServiceUri(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method creates the service uri.
member.param: Specifies a host name of the service.

member.name: P:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.SpeechRecognitionAgent.SpeechBuffer
member.summary: Gets the speech buffer to be translated to text. The audio buffer should have the following characteristics: 'SamplesPerSecond=16000', 'AudioBitsPerSample=16' and 'AudioChannel=Mono'.

member.name: T:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.SpeechResult
member.summary: This class describes the result obtained after a Hawaii Speech-to-Text call.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SpeechResult class.

member.name: P:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.SpeechResult.InternalErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the error message if an error occures during the Speech-to-Text translation.

member.name: P:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.SpeechResult.Items
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of items obtained after the speech-to-text translation.

member.name: T:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech namespace contains classes for sending audio information and receiving the textual representation of that audio through the Hawaii Speech Service.

member.name: T:Hawaii.Services.Client.Speech.SpeechGrammarsAgent
member.summary: This class provides helper methods used to communicate with the Hawaii Speech-to-Text service. It has helper methods for contacting Hawaii Speech-to-Text Service to receive all available grammars in the server. Currently, only the 'Dictation' grammar is available for a general purpose speech-to-text translation.
